an5.36:1.1: “Mendicants, there are these five timely gifts.
an5.36:1.4: A gift to someone setting out on a journey.
an5.36:1.5: A gift to someone who is sick.
an5.36:1.6: A gift at a time of famine.
an5.36:1.7: Presenting the freshly harvested grains and fruits first to those who are ethical.
an5.36:1.8: These are the five timely gifts.
an5.36:2.1: The wise give at the right time,
an5.36:2.2: being kind and rid of stinginess.
an5.36:2.3: A religious donation at the right time
an5.36:2.4: to the noble ones, upright and poised,
an5.36:3.1: given with a clear and confident mind,
an5.36:3.5: don’t miss out on the offering;
an5.36:3.6: they too have a share in the merit.
an5.36:4.1: So you should give without holding back,
an5.36:4.2: where a gift is very fruitful.
an5.36:4.3: The good deeds of sentient beings
an5.36:4.4: support them in the next world.”
